FivePoints.Threading

Class Shared<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • FivePoints.Threading.Shared<T>

  • public class Shared<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an object that is thread-protected by a mutex

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shared(T item)
      Creates a new Shared structure with the given type

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Pair<java.util.concurrent.Semaphore,T> buildShared(T data)
      Bind a mutex to the data and return it
      Pair<java.util.concurrent.Semaphore,T> getShared()
      Safely return the data from within the Shared structure
      T getSharedUnsafe()
      Unsafely return the data from within the shared structure.
      void perform(java.util.function.Consumer<T> function)
      Perform a function on a Shared piece of data, while listening to the mutex.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        public void perform(java.util.function.Consumer<T> function)
        Perform a function on a Shared piece of data, while listening to the mutex.
        Parameters:
        function - The function to perform on the piece of shared data

      • getShared

        public Pair<java.util.concurrent.Semaphore,T> getShared()
        Safely return the data from within the Shared structure
        Returns:
        A pair of this share'd data's semaphore and the data

      • getSharedUnsafe

        public T getSharedUnsafe()
        Unsafely return the data from within the shared structure. Only do this if you are sure that the data will never be modified outside of the thread that is accepting this data
        Returns:
        The data, ignoring the semaphore.

      • buildShared

        public static <T> Pair<java.util.concurrent.Semaphore,T> buildShared(T data)
        Bind a mutex to the data and return it
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data being worked with
        Parameters:
        data - The data to bind a mutex with
        Returns:
        The new structure
